message_1: Suppose $X$ is a complex projective variety of dimension $n$ and $H^{n,0}(X) = H^{0,n}(X) = \text{span}_{\mathbb{C}}\{1\}$, where $H^{p,q}(X)$ are the Hodge numbers of $X$. If $X$ is non-singular, what is the value of $h^{n,0}$?
message_2: Since $H^{n,0}(X) = \text{span}_{\mathbb{C}}\{1\}$, this means that the space $H^{n,0}(X)$ is one-dimensional and spanned by the constant function 1. Therefore, the Hodge number $h^{n,0}$, which is the dimension of the space $H^{n,0}(X)$, is equal to 1.
